summary: Meta allegedly tried to recruit employees from competitor OpenAI by offering bonuses as high as $100 million . None of OpenAI's "best people" have so far accepted Meta's alleged offers, CEO Sam Altman said . Competition to recruit artificial intelligence workers has reached an all-time high .  Meta CEOMark Zuckerberg is reportedly building a superintelligence team from artificial intelligence researchers and engineers . The Facebook owner plans to hire about 50 people for the team and will personally recruit most of the members . Zuckerberg announced Meta is investing $65 billion into AI in 2025 .

Meta's $14.3 billion bet on Scale AI, OpenAIand other partners are winding down their data relationships with Scale . OpenAI has long tapped Scale for high-quality training data, but was already dialing back that usage before Meta swooped in and brought Scale's CEO Alexandr Wang onto its superintelligence team .  Watch for where OpenAI, Google and xAI turn next for training data and whether this pullback triggers consolidation among annotation and data-labeling startups . independent data sources, smaller providers and startups may find themselves squeezed .

Meta Platforms’ advertising revenues increased 16.2% year over year to $42.3 billion in the first quarter of 2025 . Google and Alphabet are expected to hit revenues of $209.15 billion in 2025 . Global ad spending is expected to grow 4.9% in 2025 to hit $992 billion .  Meta Platforms shares have outperformed Alphabet year to date . While META shares have appreciated 18.8%, Alphabet has dropped 8.5% . Digital ad spend is anticipated to grow 7.9% to $678.7 billion .  Meta Platforms’ focus on integrating AI into its platforms — Facebook, WhatsApp, Instagram, Messenger and Threads — is driving user engagement to boost ad revenues . The company’s initiative to add updates that will help Meta AI deliver more personalized responses is expected to boost engagement .  AI Overview is currently used by more than 1.5 billion people monthly . Circle to Search has been another key catalyst driving user engagement . These factors are expected to drive Alphabet’s top-line growth .  Meta Platforms’ average surprise of 17.3% is better than Alphabet’s surprise of 14.64% . Both META and GOOGL have beat the Zacks Consensus Estimate in all the trailing four quarters . The DOJ's proposal doesn't bode well for Alphabet, given growing competition from AI-powered products like ChatGPT, Grok, DeepSeek, Perplexity and Meta AI .  Meta Platforms shares are trading at 8.89X, higher than Alphabet’s 6.13X . META's initiatives to boost top-line with plans to add ads in WhatsApp are a key catalyst .  Alphabet Inc. (GOOGL) and Meta Platforms (META) have been outperforming in recent months . Meta Platform Platforms, Inc. has been a top-ranked company in the U.S. market for the past 30 years .

B. Riley analyst Naved Khan views the Scale AI,Meta platforms (META) transaction as positive for Reddit . The implied $29B valuation for ScaleAI points to the intrinsic value of Reddit’s “large and growing corpus,” the analyst tells investors . Riley believes the independence of Reddit's dataset makes it “all the more valuable” for licensing . The firm keeps a Buy rating on Reddit with a $220 price target . Social media giant Meta Platforms (META) is doubling down on its focus on artificial intelligence . CEO Mark Zuckerberg has gone all-in on AI, and Wall Street is clearly taking notice . META stock has jumped a notable 45% from its April low of $479.80 per share .  Meta Platforms is setting its sights on the future of AI with a $14.3 billion investment in Scale AI . Despite heavy spending, the market response has remained positive . All signs point to Meta remaining a major player in the next tech era — and that makes shares worth a closer look .  In April 2025, the company launched Meta AI, a chatbot assistant that has already reached 1 billion monthly active users across its apps . Meta is also gaining traction in hardware, with AI-powered Ray-Ban smart glasses seeing user growth surge . The company is working on harnessing AI to supercharge ad targeting and boost user engagement across its entire app family, including Instagram and WhatsApp .  Meta kicked off fiscal 2025 with a blowout first-quarter earnings report on April 30 . Revenue surged 16% year-over-year to $42.3 billion, topping forecasts of $41.2 billion . Earnings per share soared 37% to $6.43, crushing estimates by a notable 23.2% margin . CEO Mark Zuckerberg highlighted Meta’s accelerating AI momentum .  Meta is heading into the second quarter with strong momentum, forecasting revenue to range between $42.5 and $45.5 billion . The company is also raising the bar on spending, boosting its 2025 capital expenditure outlook to a range of $64 billion to $72 billion . Wall Street is growing increasingly bullish on Meta, with major firms raising their price targets .  Oppenheimer bumped its price target to $775 from $665 . The firm pointed to a potential $6 billion boost in WhatsApp ad revenue, a move that signals Meta’s next big income stream is already in motion . Overall, Wall Street is giving Meta the green light with a “Strong Buy” consensus .  Street-high price target of $935 suggests that shares can still rally as much as 34% from here . Street high price target suggests that share price could still rise from here to $945 .

Meta Platforms and Booking Holdings started paying dividends last year . Both are top players in their industries and have tremendous growth prospects . The market leaders' strong underlying businesses mean they should reward shareholders with consistent dividends .  Meta Platforms' revenue increased by 16% year over year to $42.3 billion . The tech leader's earnings per share (EPS) came in at $6.43, 37% higher than the year-ago period . The company has used AI-powered algorithms to increase engagement on its apps .  Meta Platforms offers a quarterly dividend of approximately $0.52 per share . Booking Holdings helps travelers plan for their trips by providing everything from flights to accommodations, car rentals, and activities .  Booking Holdings' revenue increased by 8% year over year to $4.8 billion in the first quarter . The company's free cash flow jumped to $3.2 billion, 23% higher than the year-ago period . The more people join one of its platforms, the more attractive it is for hotels or car rental companies .  Booking Holdings began paying dividends last year, with an initial quarterly dividend of $8.75 per share, which has since increased to $9.60 . The travel and accommodation industries should maintain an upward trajectory, in the long run, thanks to factors like an increasing worldwide population and gross domestic product growth . Meta CEO Sam Altman says social media giant has been offering signing bonuses as high as $100 million in an aggressive bid to recruit OpenAI staff . Altman criticized the strategy of handing out massive guaranteed compensation, saying it may hurt innovation and distract from actual progress .  Meta has also brought in researchers from Google's DeepMind, including Jack Rae, as CEO Mark Zuckerberg continues to take a hands-on role in expanding its AI capabilities . Despite delays in rolling out its latest AI model, analysts note that Meta remains a central player in the open-source AI space .

OpenAI CEO Sam Altman says Mark Zuckerberg is trying to build a superintelligence dream team to reboot Meta's AI momentum . Mark Zuckerberg recently poured $15 billion into Scale AI and hired co-founder Alexandr Wang . Altman insists none of his best people have taken the bait .  Meta's compensation packages can reach $3.7 million . Altman called out Meta's strategy bluntly: a ton of upfront guaranteed comp doesn't build long-term innovation . But critics point to a deeper issue: even with aggressive spending, Meta's leadership in AI remains in question .

Broadcom joined the trillion-dollar club late last year . The software and chip company has been riding the AI wave as companies like Alphabet and Meta place orders for its custom AI chips . Analysts expect Broadcom’s sales to soar 22% this fiscal year and 21% in 2026 .  Nvidia is the only company in the Magnificent Seven whose sales growth surpasses Broadcom’s . Tesla's market cap is just above the $1 trillion mark . Four of the seven companies have seen their shares fall this year .  Some experts say the purpose of these groupings is to track trends, not just the most valuable companies . If the trend investors are eyeing now is AI, then swapping Tesla for Broadcom may not make sense . Another option might be to simply expand the Magnificent 7 to a Magnificent 8 .

Artificial intelligence (AI) stocks have been the must-own stocks over the past few years . We're still a long way away from full AI deployment, so many AI stocks are still worth buying . Nvidia makes graphics processing units (GPUs), which are widely deployed to train and run AI workloads .  Nvidia grew revenue 69% year over year to $44 billion in Q1 . It projects it to grow by 50% in Q2, underscoring its strength . Taiwan Semiconductor is a huge beneficiary of the massive demand that Nvidia experienced .  Taiwan Semi trades at 22.9 times forward earnings -- the same as the broader market . Investing in TSMC isn't picking a winner in the AI arms race; it's a bet that there will be increased AI spending in the future .  Meta's most aspirational investments involve its AI glasses and other gadgets that will bring AI into the real world rather than just behind a computer screen . CEO Mark Zuckerberg believes that AI glasses are the ideal form factor for deploying AI to the . real world . Meta's stock only trades on its legacy ad business . The number of US-targeted mergers and acquisitions is down by roughly 18% . But the total valueof all of this year's deals is up 10% compared to the same period in 2024 . Much of that added volume is coming from AI-related deals where "there is an absolute race"  Seven of the 15 largest US M&A deals so far this year have been about positioning for AI, according to Dealogic data . The two biggest deals came in March with Google's all-cash acquisition of cloud security platform Wiz for $32 billion .  Companies in industrials, utilities, and even private equity are doing AI deals . "There's a tremendous amount of change," PwC US deals platform leader Kevin Desai said .  Smaller companies can't as easily forecast or absorb the potential costs of President Trump's tariffs . 30% of companies said they paused or revisited pending deals due to tariffs . Citigroup expects its second quarter investment banking fees to be up in the "mid-single"  Big AI deals, at least, aren't showing signs of slowing . But that may be the saving grace for dealmakers . AI deals are still on the rise in the U.S.
